comments.creator: jmuizelaar@mozilla.com
comments.text:
Now that we are allowing google to index b.m.o it would be nice if there were ways to "query" more specifically using google. One of the ways we could implement this is by using particular tokens on pages that would be reasonably unique. For example, if all of the bugs that we're Status:NEW had the word "status-new" you could search for them by adding to "status-new" to your google query.

One way to implement this might be to serve special pages to the google bot that have the additional unique tokens.

comments.raw_text:
We could use the <meta name="description"> tag in <head> to do this possibly. As a rule, Google does not use the <meta keywords=""> tag so that wouldn't be preferable. 

It could be something like this:

<meta name="description" content="id:123456 product:Foo component:Bar status:NEW priority:P1 ...">

Then you could do status:NEW in your search terms.

dkl
